channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024071024
item.description:
Report X-2024071024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-17T18:15:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-06
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 5th, during the PM sort a pallet of drums was found leaking. The drums contained UN1263, Paint, 3, III. Two of the drums were damaged at the handles, one was damaged at the top chime, the last one was damaged at the bottom chime. The four leaking drums were placed into a steel salvage drums and amended shippers declarations were requested.

item.title: Report E-2024070265
item.description:
Report E-2024070265

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 3, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of sodium hydroxide was damaged by a forklift and released approximately four (4) pounds of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools to collect the loose product and damaged bag. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024070912
item.description:
Report X-2024070912

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A plastic jerrycan was found with a release at the MEMH location during sort operations. The jerrycan was leaking from the cap which wasn't tight. The cap was tightened and it was placed into a steel salvage package. A new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024070911
item.description:
Report X-2024070911

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found with signs of a release at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained three glass jars wrapped in layers of brown paper and taped closed with Styrofoam peanuts foe dunnage. A lid on one of the jars was not sealed properly and that was the cause of the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024070666
item.description:
Report X-2024070666

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the unloading process at the MEMH location two fiberboard boxes were found with signs of a release. Both fiberboard boxes were apart of the same shipment. Each fiberboard box contained four plastic bottles and each one had a bottle with a loose cap causing the release. All contents were placed into steel salvage packages and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024070671
item.description:
Report X-2024070671

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained four plastic jugs separated with a fiberboard divider. One of the plastic jugs cracked on the body causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024070669
item.description:
Report X-2024070669

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained three glass bottles that were packaged in individual plastic sealed bags. One of the bottles broke and spilled it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and anew declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024070668
item.description:
Report X-2024070668

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a plastic container was dropped causing a spill. The container hit the edge of the catwalk causing a puncture on the bottom. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
